column4: hey all what would be the regex for finding '58G' using grep ... thats (digit)(digit)G
hmm. you're right. let me check what's up with that.
I've used it before, but its been a while
I normally just use python RE anyway, hence the delay :-)
looking for large directories on my server du -hc | grep -E '[0-9]{2}G'
it will grab a little junk, but I can sort it out to find it :)
is there a way to make it only look at the first 4 chars... possibly awk..
yup. you might try running filelight at your server at some point. very nice & visual way of finding out where the large dirs go
^ = start of line. start with that :-)
good luck with your endevours. -> afk.
